text: Goudblond bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: eerst wat solfer en fenol, daarna hop en fruitig. Smaak: moutzoetige aanzet, hopbitter, fruitig, nectarine, ananas. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Goede afdronk, harsachtig bitter.

On tap at Vrteka 2017, Belgrade. Shared with Vinja 666. Hazy golden, small off-white head. Moderate to heavily hopped or is it spices, citrus; lemon; zest. Good balance, very aromatic with floral esters. Medium body, moderate carbonation, really nice fruity finish. I like it just the way it is.

On tap at Vrteka. Tropical aroma, creamy, somewhat citrusy, a bit grainy. Tropical, light taste, fresh, lime, creamy, nice citric touches, light Belgian yeast touches I reckon. This is a very, VERY tasty beer, aromatic, well balanced and drinkable. Wow!

Tap at LExpress De Lyon, 26th April 17. Pours straw colour, slight haze. Aroma is bitter hop, some citrus. Taste is bitter, oily hop, citrus, clean refreshing with a bitter linger. This is as I hoped a little like the De Ranke style of Belgian Ale.
Aromas pretty good with fresh hops and caramel malt. Flavors a bit off with the loss of hop flavor being more bitter than sweet. Good body and a long bitter finish.

Here is our first rating for a beer from Italy, a country renowned for shitty beer, but thankfully, it bucks that tradition by being pretty darn good. It pours a cloudy gold and has an aroma that combines lemony "zest," belgian yeast, and a light delicate touch of that bretty funk. The taste is pretty much in line with the smell; it is complex, tasty, and hard to pin down. My better half thinks it tastes like it has a higher ABV than it does, but Im not sure thats it, but I cant quite put my finger on it. Anyway, its a good beer that does Italian beer proud. Good for gorging on some naan pizza while regaling your booboo with tales of internet DJ heroism.

Bottle at Osteria La Mandorla. Aroma: Esters and citrus. Appearance: Golden body and nice head. Taste: Very peppery, ester fruit with nice citrus, bit of alcoholic background. Palate: Semi-dry finish, medium-low body, medium carbonation.

Bottle, 330 ml, courtesy og Kreso. Shared with him and others. Pours hazy golden, large white head. Great citrus grapefruit aroma, hoppy, fruity, bit yeasty, smooth with dry and lasting bitter finish. Medium bodied. Nice one.

On tap @ Extraomnes Bier & cibo. Giallo dorato, velato, con schiuma bianca, non troppo fine ma persistente. Aroma intenso, complesso, dal fruttato tipico del lievito belga, pesca sciroppata, frutta a polpa bianca, note speziate, quasi pepate. Secca, piuttosto amara, molto meno fruttata del suo aroma, ha note di cereali e pane appena cotto. Finale erbaceo. poco corposa, basso calore alcolico, carbonatazione intensa,particolarmente dissetante. Equilibrata e perfettamente armonica.
Bottle from biere-mport. Light hazy dark gold color. Medium white head. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Aroma and flavour is barnyard, fruity, pepper, pinneapple. Pretty good.

Tasted on 18.11.16. Great citrus hoppy aroma. Small head disappearing to thin layer. Hazy light orange colour. Intensive citrus and herbal hoppy bitterness in taste with delicate spiciness in aftertaste.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Lotto 132 16, best before 30/11/17, aperta il 29 gennaio 2017.
Dorata opalescente, schiuma bianca fine, appiccicosa, di buona persistenza.
Aroma di pepe bianco, lime, pompelmo, maracuja, uva spina, erbaceo fresco, fiori darancio, chiodo di garofano molto molto leggero.
Al palato pompelmo e uva spina, finale caratterizzato principalmente da pompelmo accompagnato da amaro erbaceo e crosta di pane.
Secca, molto carbonata, corpo medio, molto beverina e rinfrescante.

Robe dorée, belle mousse abondante et crémeuse. Nez superbe sur des notes citronnées, fruitées, houblonnées, pointe de pêche. Bouche à lattaque fraîche et acidulée, belle bulle fine et raffraîchissante, longue finale sur le houblon frais. Une superbe bière de soif. Un régal pour finir la soirée.
Dorata, con schiuma a grana fine, frutta, principalmente pesca, e tanto citrico con buona speziatura. Ben fatta.

Draft at FOB, in Rimini, Italy. Color is pale blond, with white fine foam. Aroma is not strong, but reminds of white-pulp fruit like peach. Body is light. Taste is moderately bitter, worth some spicing. Dry palate.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is quite citrussy with some citra hops and yellow fruits. Taste is zest with some yellow fruits, citrus and a medium bitter finish. Nice.

0,33l bottle at home. BB 30.06.2017. yellow golden clear shiny color, small white head. smells of forest berries, flowery, some sweet herbs, light spices, very light yeast. very lovely smell. medium body, medium carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, spices, some sweet herbs again, hints of berries, a bit soapy, light fruity notes, light yeast. finishes lightly dry and a bit soapy with notes of herbs, citric notes and light yeast. quite nice beer, very well made, lovely flavours. enjoyed it very much.

330ml bottle (Koht Auction, Tallinn)
FIzzy pour, hazy straw. Pleasant belgian aroma, partly saisony. Light palate, crisp carbonation. Nice tingly hop bitterness, pleasant bitter bready body, a bit grassy. Finish bitter, more grassiness. A bit too fizzy, thats its only flaw.

A light yellow beer, a head is medium and white. Aroma has fruitness, lemon, some sourness of citrusfruits and spicyness. Balanced and fresh aroma. Taste has fresh fruitness, lemon, earthy sourness. Medium bodied, smooth carbonation. Refreshning. Lemony and tasteful beer.

10oz glass at The Sovereign DC. Pours a hazy gold with some tight, white head. Nose is inviting and pleasant, lemon zest, white pepper, straw, grass. More IPA than Belgian Ale. Flavor has a little bit of tropical fruit, lemon, dried white grapefruit zest, pepper, coriander, straw. Dry finish. Had one of these on a night when I had many sweet Belgians and this was a nice respite.

In bottiglia. Colore ocra chiaro/bianco navajo, torbido. Testa soapy, di dissolvenza da rapida a media. Magnifico naso di luppolo, scorza dagrumi, paglia umida e litchi. Carbonazione da leggera e media, sottile e solleticante. Buon aroma di scorza dagrumi, luppolo amaro floreale, fiori umidi e lievito. Gusto mediamente dolce, poi amaro da leggero a medio, con recupero del lievito ad inspessirsi. Buona luppolatura croccante. Leggero alcool nel finale, breve e un po acquoso, per una beva essenzialmente pulita ma anche meno ricca del previsto. Corpo da leggero a medio, trama watery. Una birra non così intensa come mi aspettavo, comunque lodevole e davvero ben congegnata dal solito buon Extraomnes.

On tap at Novare Res. Pour is a really hazy golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of zest, citrus, pepper and not too phenolic overall. Taste is peppery again and moderately bitter, offers more citrus zest and juice. Body is a bit light and carbonation moderately high. A reallly refreshing belgian ale, a superior example of the style! A white wine BA version of this would rock I think!

4 oz pour on draft at B Side, served in a wine glass. Hazy golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of floral notes, herbs, spice, citrus. Tastes of herbs, spice, citrus fruit and peel. Medium body with a dry finish.

Lightly hazed tepid yellow appearance with the thinnest of surface foam. Straw and rotting grass lead the pungent aroma, which swells with saltiness, pear skins, and honeyed dough malts. Cobweb yeasts cloud things appropriately, white pepper and dried herbs gathering the noble hops.

Light, playful fruitiness in the flavor offers overripe banana and yellow apple, with prickly herbs and peppercorns. Continuously quiet in disposition, but always observably complex; its mostly dried floral tones and understated field and farm funk. Clean yeasts, crisp malts, elegant noble hops. 

Soft and zesty texture. Crisp and buoyant, while doughy and dense. A great approximation of the best Belgian blonde ales; hoppy, snappy, minerallic. The glass was finished before I knew what happened.
Some citrus and light hay. Pours hazy yellow with great head and carpet lacing. Light bitter finish. Easy drinking. Tap at pizza paradiso.

On tap 4 oz. sampler at Pizza Paradiso in DuPont Circle, Washington, DC. 

Hazy, sparkling, golden yellow with a fine off-white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of lemony citrus, peppery spices, hay and bread. 

Taste of lemony citrus, hay, spicy yeast, grass and bread. 

Medium body and medium/low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Allinizio risulta evidente la parte maltata, con sentori di crosta di pane, poi un gradevole speziato, forse di pepe ed un finale amaro persistente

On tap at EurHop festival in Rome-Italy. Pours hazy golden-yellow color, bright. White tick foam. Nose: fruity, tons of spices, lemon grass. Great! Mouth: extremely fresh, spicy-peppery in the palate, Fresh citric finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bon style belge houblonné . Agrumes,résine . Une belle persistance en bouche.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. 
A: Pours a cloudy orange color forming a big and light bubbled white head with good retention forming some lingering lacings in the glass. 
S: Very grassy and citrus nose. Very American Pale Ale. Strong notes of sweet pale malts and American style hops. Very zesty and citrus. Strong notes of grapefruit. Flowery finish. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Very malty, fruity, citrus and hoppy beer. Strong notes of pale and caramel malts. Grapefruit, mango and pine. In overall, a quite dry and bitter taste. Lovely. 
M: Light body. Good carbonation. Zesty aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkability. Excellent Ale.

Colore giallo dorato, naso fruttato di pesca con buon equilibrio tra malto e luppolo...lievito presente... schiuma bianca non troppo abbondante, ma persistente...gusto intenso e complesso....malto, e fruttato avvertito prima al naso... buon amaro persistente..sapori in evouzione... buon finale amaro...ottimissima birra...
tap at Luppolo12, Rome. hazy, hay color. firm head. Very citrusy and fermented hay aroma. A bit sour taste. Very long developing after flavor.
Hazy, lemony yellow pour with a thick white head. Slightly spicy, peppery, lemon and bread aromas. Taste is lemon spritz, slightly sweet, which quickly dries out.

33cl bottle at BrewDog, Firenze. Pours slightly hazy golden to orange with a white head. Fruity aroma with peaches, some citrus, mild malty notes and hints of herbs and yeast. Moderate to medium sweet with nice fruity and hoppy flavours and a somewhat dry and medium bitter finish. Tasty and sessionable.
Large white frothy head strong carbonation straw coloured pour aromas extra citrus notes, strong bitter lots of zest used plenty of hops used in the flavours. Too much lemon for mee ;)

On tap at LExpress de Lyon-- Pours hazy yellow with medium white head. Citrusy and yeasty nose. Aromas are citrus and grass. Lively carbonation, medium texture. Long bitter and acid finish with a lemony dominant.
Draft sample at BQ bar in Naviglio Grande 44, Milano, Italy 5/5/15. Very good!

Bottle. 5.3%. Best before 31.08.16. 10 cl. sample. Pours a hazy, pale yellow with a disappearing white head. Grassy hop aroma, cereals. Sweetish, grassy hop flavour, with a hint of citrus. Dry finish with a citrus bitterness, a bit tart. Overall, the bitterness feels a bit unbalanced, and its too grassy. 01.05.15.
Small white head, golden, citrus, herbs, some ester, phenolic aroma, medium bitterness, long lasting taste very dry finish very interesting beer, light body,
VBC 2015 unclear yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of citrus, herbs, fresh and bitter. A flavor of citrus, herbs, spice, lemon and fresh bitter.
Bottle share at VBC. Very pale yellow with a small white head. Very citrussy aroma, lemon springs to mind. Medium low body, high bitterness and hop flavour. Very nice.

Keg in BQ Naviglio 44, Milan. Light yellow colour, hazy, thick white foam. Caveat that this is pretty much my ideal beer style, but this was great. Clean crisp malt, spicy fruity yeast, long prickly almost salty nagging hop bitterness. Splendidly quenching.

From 330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a tightly packed white head and moderate carbonation. Aromas of lemon, flowers, cut grass, peach, white bread and pepper. Taste is grapefruit and lemon right up front before a pine note comes through with firm bitterness right to the end. Citrus and floral aftertaste. Really interesting beer.
Birra con forti aromi agrumati e variegati, molto amara, abbastanza astringente, ma abbastanza bilanciata e decisamente complessa nei sentori che sprigiona. Interessante!

Eccellente ale dellitaliana Extraomnes, biondo pallido con schiuma compatta e cremosa. Buono laroma di agrumi, allassaggio è netta la prevalenza di agrumi, limone e simili, con una tendenza allerbaceo. Spinge verso laspro senza mai esagerare, risultando quindi molto leggera e bevibile. Unottima birra estiva, specie per chi ama di più i gusti aspri e agrumati.
Bottle 33cl @ Damilo. Pours hazy yellow, small white head. Citrus, yeast, soap in the aroma. Citrus, spices, yeast in the flavor.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Rome.
Pours pale hazy golden color with a white head. Lemon zest and lots of it on the nose, orange, some herbal notes and yeast. Citric fruits and spices on the flavor, yeast and some hops too. Refreshing and tasty.
3325

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Rome
Aroma has citrus, orange and apricot. Feels slightly musty. Flavour has apricot, citrus, mild spicy and floral tones. Also some grapefruit. A bit too much citrus for me here.
sample at Tasting at Moor Pat, Williamsville, NY. Golden pour, mango, grapefruit, candied apricot. Fruity yeast, dry finish. Nice flavor, good drinking 7474715
birra appena velata cappello bianco, schiuma fine è compatta. al naso percettibili note di pesca e spezie. interessante in bocca per lamaro elegante e pieno, non aggressivo, interessante birra

Bella birra bionda appena velata, con schiuma bianca fine è compatta. Odore di pesca, mela verde e tante spezie. Corpo leggero, tessitura esile, con un bel lattacco secco e senza zuccheri. Amalgama perfetto e finale amaro, Co le spezie e gli aghi di pino che ritornano. Mi dispiace per chi non ha capito la birra ma è fatta in maniera esemplare.

Had this months ago. Pours pale, white, hazy and a bit weird looking. Strong citric hop aroma, skunky. Some yeast, white IPAish. Taste is also like white IPA, bitter hops, some skunkiness. Tongue feels bitterness for a while longer. Dry. Citric. Refreshing.

33cl bottle. Pours cloudy pale yellow with a thick bubbly white head. Aroma is light sweet malts, lemon, ripe fruits, yeast, light lactic acidity. Taste is less malty and more fruity with a very dry sharp finish. Light bitterness, light to medium body, lively carbonation.
Draught at one of Mick Wallace?s joints. Cloudy blonde, lovely whipped cream like head. Big zesty nose, loads of rind, flavour follows, lovely light fizzy texture. Musty notes in the finish.Gorgeous.
33 cl bottle. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma of exotic fruits, citrus, passion fruit, kiwi. Flavour is sweet, hoppy. Quite astringent. Dry finish.
Bottle pour at Jimmy's 43 battle of the Belgian event. Flavorful with a floral hoppy taste . Decent

On tap at Hoppy Days. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, zest, light malty, some toast. Flavour is light sweet, malty, citrus, lemon zest, lemon, light soapy, bitter finish. Light-bodied. Nice, but was a bit snowed under by all the other great beers on offer that evening. Will have to revisit.

On tap at Hoppy Days. Clear gold pour with thick white head. Aroma is nice and zesty, tons of fresh grassy notes, light lemon grass, light biscuity notes. Taste is nice light bready malt, very lemony. Palate is light, dry, med carbonation. Really tasty.
Birra di ispirazione belga con tanto citra in aroma e un amaro importante, una delle mie birre preferite

from Fork&Bottle - pours a cloudy blond beer under a long lasting white foam; fair hoppy aroma of pineapples and litchies, lemongrass; medium-bodied, fresh, assertive and tasty; fairly bitter with some tart acidity; very dry and long fruity hoppiness (star fruits and pineapple) - a great and impressively accurate beer
Draft at Hoppy Days. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, saison yeast, pepper. Flavour is light sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Bottle at the Italian Bar, GBBF 2014. Light golden rusty orange, medium white head. Nose is lots of lemon peel, zesty lemon, some bitter grapefruit, lots of hop, and a bit of yeast ester or saison yeast aroma. Cereal grain malt character. Taste is sharp bitter lemon rind, sweetness, hop bitter, some pine, some of that saison yeast character, and then on the finish its got some nettle and pine. Decent body to it, full flavoured.
A citrus accented IPA. A bit greener and leafier than modern American versions with a certain endearing quality, without ever sinking its hooks in.

My Bottom Line:
Passionfruit and lemon whirl around bread crumbs until herbal resins take control of the finish.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam laces around the hazy shiny blond.
-It doesnt feel as airy, dry and carbonated as their Blond, but its still very drinkable and refreshing.
-There is a lot of yeast in their bottles. Be careful when pouring.
-This gets more and more endearing with every sip.
-Green peppercorns appear in the finish.

Bottle.

Bouteille. La cervoise91. Robe dorée coiffée dune mousse blanche dense. Nez citronné et malté. Bouche fraiche, maltée et fruitée sur le pamplemousse avec une belle note florale de houblon. Finale zestée et amère avec une pointe dépices. Une bière rafraichissante très agréable. "Shes fresh so fresh, exciting"...
Extraomnes birrificio del varesotto di qualità. Questa Zest è una birra dissetante e beverina. Buona.

How: Draught.
Where: Open Baladin Roma.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, malt, grapefruit.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, citrus, spices, hops.
Bottle. Big grapefruit aroma, lots of citrus, taste is less fruity. Light skunkiness. Quite refreshing, feels more ipa like than belg.

Very cloudy, almost white, blonde color. Big hoppy dry nose with lemon zest, big skunkiness, with a bit of torrified wheat notes. Very dry hoppy mouth, not tons of complexity. Good yeasty character. Dry. Bitter finish. Light body. Decent.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 Pours a quite small, but with a thin stable layer, frothy white head; colour its light golden orange, just a bit hazy. Strong and wrapping aroma: big citrus and fruits, lemons, oranges, pineapple, grass, tropical fruits, some spices. Taste its intially a bit sweet and very fruity, but immediately turns to the more citrusy side and leaves place to the sour and delicate bitter notes. Palate is clean with a nice delicate bitter and a soft carbonation; the finish just screams for the next sip. What I like most about it its the fact that you can enjoy  those citrus and fruit flavours without drinking an extremly bitter and heavily hopped beer, as the majority are today. Any other invading flavours; greatly balanced between sour and bitter. Very exotic, incredible aroma; enjoyable cause its simple. Refreshing and drinkable, youll want another glass.

Bottle shared @ home with SuBarbare. Color: hazy blond beer with small carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: citrus notes as orange and lemon with some pineapple. Taste: high fruity taste with good balance of malt. Really drinkable. Aftertaste: nice sweet dry bitterness.

Bottle. Hazy orange pour, thin white head. Aroma of fruity hops, somewhat floral, some resin, a hint of pine, some yeast and unfermented sugars. Flavor is bitter hops, somewhat fruity and sugary. Nice body and a nice balance. A bit rough edges, but overall a decent brew.
Una belgian ale generosamente luppolata, con note fruttate e leggermente citriche, sfondo di lieviti belga. Buona!

330 ml bottle from Les Vignerons, served in a tulip glass. Pale gold, quite hazy, with a huge, fluffy and forever lasting white head. Very fruity aroma, pungent and almost balsamic. Mainly notes of peach, light strawberry, generic fruit esters, mild alchool and spices. Taste pretty much follow suite. VERY dry as expected (and hoped!) slightly astringent malt component, a bit herbal and grassy. It does also have that rustic saison feel to it. Average to lively carbonation, light body and creamy texture. Simply great.
Bottle from Plonk (Dec 2013). Hazy pale orange, off white head, nice Belgian characters, yeast, spicy, peach, passionfruit, hay/straw, medium bitterness, medium body, slightly yeasty finish. Nice.

Meravigliosa birra super dissetante e beverina. Colore chiaro torbido con schiuma bianca. Aromi erbacei e floreali molto intensi ed interessanti. In bocca sorprende per la magnifica bilanciatura acido-amara e larmonia di sapore speziato e floreale piacebolissimo. Finale secco e pulito. I miei complimenti al birrificio! Questa birra è un CAPOLAVORO! (Bevuta alla spina nella birroteca Vaffalluppolo di Fermo)

Bottle 33cl, cloudy yellow orange beer with medium head. Nose is floral with light lemon and fresh exotic fruits. Aroma is medium malty, lot of agrumes, very bitter, grapefruit notes, quite sharp. Long bitterness on aftertaste with long duration. Nice
Original beer with a wonderful combination of fruit aroma . Tasting it , its very pleasant the sensation of freshness you feel but i think it miss something.Recommended

Draught @ Open Baladin, Rome. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, light sweet fruity, peach, passion, citrus. Flavor is malty, yeast, fruity hops, passionfruit, peach, citrus. Medium body, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. 070414

Bottle shared by Joes @ weekly tasting. Hazy a bit pale yellow color, small white head. Smell hops, some citrus. Taste hops, lightly citrus, nicely bitter. Probably my extreme pollen allergy causes me to miss some other flavors, but still pretty nice. Nice fresh, easy drinkable beer. Id say this is an APA and not a Belgian Ale, but whatever. Nice one.

Bottle @ home shared by joes. Very hazy pale yellow colour with a small to very small white head. Smells hops, toiletpaper/wet newspaper, fresh. Tastes hoppy, slightly sour, fresh, lemongrass, grassy. Nice. Thin body, soft carbo.
Golden yellow body, white head. Citrussy, yeasty peppery, toasty malt. Very nice balanced combo.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2014 White weak head. Deep golden colour. Aroma is hoppy, citrusy with apricot and peach notes. Flavor is hoppy too with fruity (peach, pear, citrus) and light spicy tones, ending in a long hoppy finish. Light to medium bodied.

Bottle (330 ml). Hazy golden/orange with a medium off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is of citrus zest, tropical fruits, yeast, spices, floral notes and malt. Taste is of tropical fruits (kiwi?), citrus zest, yeast, spices, light sweetness and floral notes. Sticky bitterness. Medium body. Medium/moderate carbonation. Slightly dry mouthfeel. Spicy. Fruity for a Belgian Ale. Tasty and drinkable. Balance isnt bad at all. My first from Extraomnes, but definitely not the last. Very good!
Pours a cloudy golden. Aroma is sweet fruits and spicy yeast. Taste is malty,bit of fruits,bitter aftertaste.
Hazy blond, fresh kiwi and papaya aromas, sweet and fruity, similar palate that has a somewhat uncomfortable balance.

Tasting at birratrovo in Como
Really good beer very fruity in aroma and tasty in taste

Bottle 33cl, cloudy yellow orange beer with medium head. Nose is floral with light lemon and fresh exotic fruits. Aroma is medium malty, lot of agrumes, very bitter, grapefruit notes, quite sharp, yes kind of lemon zest. Long bitterness on aftertaste with long duration. Mono-dimensional.

Draught @ Chez Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles, Brussels, 3.9.2012. Hazy yellow beer with tall frothy, white head. Aroma is fresh with some grainy malts, grassy hops and citric fruits. Flavour is grainy malts, citric fruits and grassy hops. Quite dry, medium bodied, very fresh.
Bottiglia, 033. Schiuma bianca persistente Fantastici aromi molto fruttati, in perfetta corrispondenza gusto olfativa.
poco belga. lo speziato dei livieti è coperto dal fruttato carico e uva spina. canonizzazione un filo eccessiva che la renderà piacevole col caldo. colore oro effettivamente con toni verdi. buona.

Alla spina. Schiuma bianca persistente. Colore biondo tendente al bianco. Aroma stupendo di frutta agra dal limone alluva spina. In bocca il corpo è bilanciato per supportare londata di agro. Finale secco e persistente.

Robe orange pale troublée, pas deffervescence. Au nez : très florale, la levure est présente également. En bouche, forte amertume, citron, pamplemousse. Amertume très longue en bouche qui masque beaucoup les arômes.
[18-OCT-2013] Bottle from Domus Birrae in Rome. Yellow to golden, aroma of hops, lemon, very fresh, flavor is bitter with lemon skin, dry, easy to drink, medium bodied

[10/9/13] Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas in Brussels. Clear deep golden with a nice big white head. Nice hoppy and yeast aroma , floral, citric and a bit fruity. Dry-ish flavor with some yeasty fruitiness, floral and citric hops and a moderately bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Nice.

Hazy gold with a nice white foamy head. Aroma hoppy, citrus, spice, some yeast, puts me in mind of a hoppy Blanche. Taste fairly bitter and hoppy. Spicy (which get stronger on palate), orange and coriander. Palate spicy and hoppy. Dry and refreshing.

Clean golden body and stable yet flimsy head. Belgian whit elike yeast, crisp, citric, very pale malts, a bit floral. Light bitter, taste is a bit farmy, but not as expressive as Id like. Its nice but not amazing. Its really my kind of brew but has flaws. Bit too clean I think. Tasty though. (33cl bottle from Dranken Geers)
On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Hoppy blond beer. Lasting white head. Yeast and hops on the aroma. Ok. Pretty decent to be honest. Hops are light in flavour but penetrating in the bitterness. Good
2013.09 - fles 33cl - helder goudgeel bier, veel bellen, badschuimkraag - neus : naar bloemen ruikende hop, gist - mond : bitter met een kleine zoetzure toets - droog - biertje met eigen karakter
On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Poured pale golden with a huge white head. Herbal hop nose, hints of grass. Sweeter in the mouth, slightly yeasty. A good Italian take on a Belgian blond.
bottle a hazy light yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy citrus fruits and hops flavor malts spicy citrus fruits pineapple and a bitter hoppy finish

Draught at "MadreBirra 2013" - Brescia. Clear golden hazy color, elegant bubbly aspect and very good creamy head duration. Much fruity malty nose, rich perfumed of cellar, white aged grapes, yeast. Sweet start but strongly bitter palate on the end. Good and equilibrate alcoholic perception.

Tap @ BQ Milan. Pours cloudy golden with a small bully lacing head. Aroma is hoppy piny grapefruits cat bin a bit malty frutiy. Flavor is dry hoppy fruity yeasty spicy astringent darn so nicely bitter. Geeat bitter dry finish.

Bottle at home. Hazy gold and white head. Aroma of lemon juice, orange zest, cloves, piss and a hint of grapefruit. Taste is a lot of lemon zest and juice, sharp bitterness, some tropical fruits, grassy notes, citrus sourness, parsley and cloves,some bread,sweet pale malts.  In the aftertaste more citrus hoppiness. Not much carbonation and a slightly thin mouthfeel.
Pours hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, grass and a light malty note. Taste is very balanced bittersweet, clean and crisp. Dry finish. A great beer this one!

Una birra fantastica, da bere a secchiate. Inizio da classica ale belga, e finale lungo,pulito e secchissimo. Una di quelle birre che vorresti non finisse mai, insieme con la blond la mia birra preferita di extraomnes.

330ml bottle, bbe 06/2014. Cloudy and hazy muddy light orange with some bubbly white head. Aroma is citrusy, orange, herbal, light cats piss. Taste is sharp citrus, light hay, grass, slightly herbal. Dry finish. Medium to high carbonation, airy and soft mouthfeel.

Aroma luppolato citrico di zest (ma va) di agrume. Appare nel bicchiere dorata-ambrata con un bel cappello di schiuma persistente. Al palato ingresso dolce evolve verso canoni decisamente più agrumati (ancora zest di limone e pompelmo) sul finire. Ultimamente cè stato un aggiornamento della ricetta che lha resa un pò più luppolata sul finale. Io preferivo la ricetta precedente che le conferiva un più di equilibrio. Ma ovviamente sono gusti. Resta una gradevole birra molto rinfrescante.
Bottled. Easy to drink, with a pale colour and a persistent head. It has a spicy and a little bit fruity taste. Very good! Fortunately I bought a six pack! :D

330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique. Very citrus like aroma with lemon, grapefruit and orange aroas all coming through. Very fruity and inviting. The white foam laces the glass and leaves a trail of bubbles across the surface of the beer. Dull orange colour a lively mouthfeel, even though it stats off a bit thin none mouth it does build to a smooth mouthfeel. The flavour is good and leaves a nice fruitiness on the palate.

Pours cloudy light-orange with wispy white head. Aroma is full of clove, coriander, banana and caramel. Flavour is refreshingly bitter and peppery to counterbalance the sweetness

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a golden orange with a nice white head. Nose has orange, lemon and zest spices. Taste doesn't quite give what the nose promised. Some light sour fruits in the taste. Not bitter at all. Session beer for summer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a light orange with yellow highlights. Small amount of white head. Nose is orange and peach, lovely and fruity. Light bodied, peach and citrus on the attack, medium hops and some grapefruit on the finish. Nicely balanced and very refreshing.
Pours a very pale colour with a thick head and lemon dominated aroma. Some spice and sour fruits in the taste. Very nice on the nose but the taste lacked a little
. Clear pale gold beer, medium off white head. Aroma is light pepper, some grass. dry and bitter finish.

Pour is clear pale yellow with a tight white head.  Nose is lemons up front, lots of yeast and very spicey.  More lemon with orange peel citrus hop profile in back.  Taste is lemon pledge, fairly spicy and yeasty to balance with the orange peel in the finihs.  Body is is light with a faint bitterness in a finish that falls off a bit lacking carbonation.
Questa è la mia tipologia di birra perfetta, una blond sullo stile belga che però ha dalla sua una luppolatura più spinta, non dissimile dalla xx bitter ma con un tocco di originalità tutta sua.
oro buona schiuma media persistenza speziato citrico agrumato pompelmo buon asecchezza finale agrumato buon amaro

Tap at Ma Che, Trastevere, Roma - 02/10/12.
Hazy light blonde with a mahoosive foamy white head which retains very well. A very lively pour that took a while to come out!
Belgian yeast strains on the nose, big citrus hit, lemon and a little piss.
Taste largely follows the nose, no piss, lemon and spice, some hops.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp refreshing finish.
Worth the wait, great feel to this one, massages the throat as it goes down!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Colore Ambra chiaro, schiuma bianca e pannosa non abbondante. Profumo agrumato e floreale. Di corpo medio leggero, amara. Carbonazione vivace. Finale amaro. Piacevole.

Dorata, opalescente, schiuma bianca pannosa e persistente.
aromi agrumati e resinosi (scorza darancia, pompelmo rosa, cedro...)
Secca, poco corpo, piuttosto amara.....fresca e beverina, ma non nelle mie corde.....
Birra fantastica! Buon aroma! Bella, con una bellissima schiuma bianca e pannosa, in pò torbida, sapore fruttato e sopratutto amaro, buccia darancia su tutti! Retrogusto amaro lungo e persistente.

Bottle. Hazy orange with a large white head. Aroma of a flowering lemon tree, grapefruit, dough, vanilla, cloves. Light-bodied, quite carbonated. A little grain and dough, plenty of lemon and grapefruit peel, a touch of tropical fruit. Dry finish with sharp bitterness, slightly metallic. Unbalanced with Id say more dry-hopping than the beer can take.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours light orange-yellow with a small, firm white cap on top of it. Nice lacing left behind it all. Nose is very zesty as the name alludes to. Lots of lemon, lime and orange, as well as some herbal notes and spice - coriander, basil, wheatgrass. Taste has all the zest and spice the nose promises with a touch of biscuit and dough backing it. Palate is soft and spritzy carbonation. Lengthy, light bitterness. Nice and appealing stuff

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2012 Intense aroma and floral hops. The taste is delicate and the ending leaves a strong bitterness.
On tap is more fresh and with herbal and citrus aroma.

(Draught at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels, 18 July 2012) Pale golden colour with frothy white head. Malty, hoppy nose with notes of grainy malt, grass and lemon. Malty, hoppy taste with grainy malt, grass, lemon peel and a fresh, citric bitterness in a dry finish. Medium body, dry. Well balanced and tasty with a fresh hop character. Very nice.

Birra velata, con presenza di lieviti in sospensione....al naso molto fruttata, frutta gialla, persistente....alla bevuta dapprima dolce di frutta gialle seguito da una ventata di fresco amaro lungo e non troppo invadente...veramente ben bilanciata

Bottle. A hazy medium golden beer. with a large, frothy, lacing, mostly lasting, white head. The aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain/bread), moderately hoppy (grapefruit, pine needles, flowers, grass), lightly to moderately yeasty (dust, dough), with notes od tropical/exotic fruits (papaya, passion fruit, pineapple etc.), grapes. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body,  velvety texture, lively carbonation, dry, long finish with medium to heavy bitterness. In few words another excellent, light hoppy beer from EXtraomnes. Great aroma, fruity, drinkable, with a nicxe body etc.

29-Aug-12 (Beer Deluxe) - Peach apricot herbal duvel like aroma. Light cloudy amber colour, good head and good ringed sheet lacing. Big herbal hop and sweet citrus salt flavour. Herbal citrus hop finish and dry herbal aftertaste.

Large white frothy head strong carbonation straw coloured pour aromas passionfruit citrus sweetness notes some floral the flavours strong bitter lots of zest used plenty of hops used in the flavours but as for the bitter tastes well for me no thanks the finish overdone bitter taste nauseating salty like a big NO

Pours orangey amber with a large, growing white head.
Pleasant aroma of spicy phenols, perfume-like floral notes, and doughy yeast.
Flavours include the same spicy notes and doughy yeast, before a strong hoppy prescence takes enters with a bold, sharp bitterness and spicy noble-like finish. Perhaps too much hops for such a light and dry beer.
Great moderately-high carbonation works wonders.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2015 Color giallo lievemente torbido, ricco di bollicine e con un cappello spesso di schiuma bianca saponosa molto persistente. Aroma "fresco" di agrumi e macedonia di pesche con sentori floreali e leggermente speziati. Gusto inizialmente medio-dolce con una parvenza di bucce darancia che evolve rapidamente verso un amarognolo secco e asciutto dominato dai luppoli. Di corpo lieve, con una vivace effervescenza che la rende dissetante. Estiva!

Golden coloured beer with a head that sticks very nice to the glass. Smell is overall pretty nice with a good amount of hops and a citrus-touch, but there is getting some kind of smart-smell behind that makes it unpleasant. The same thing is getting back inside the taste also, besides the overall good hopped basic. Dont know what it is, but it is ruining this beer for me for sure, and its from the beer for sure. Could have been around 3.5 without it. Gets slightly better when warmed up a little, but still...

Pint at BQ Alzaia, Milano. It pours a slightly unclear yellow/golden colour with a big white head. Long lasting foam. Aroma is stunning: citrus, loads of orange zest, some yeasty spiciness, wow intese. Taste is bitter-ish with a tad of acidity n the back. Orange, lemon peel, black pepper, dry, some funk and yesty presence. Hoppy for sure. Wow. Body is medium with good carbonation. Overall, this beer rocks. Super-tasty, super-refreshing, super-amazing.
cloudy yellow, smooth white head. flowery spicy aroma, citrussy hops. flavor is citrussy hoppy, malty, dry malty, citrussy dry malty hoppy. nice.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker,Gent, Belgium, Friday 8th June 2012 consumed Sunday 24th June 2012  Pours hazy lemony to gold with a white head. Lovely hoppy nose, soft in the mouth good citrussy bite. Dryness at the end. Good beer.  A6 A3 T8 P3 Ov15  3.5

Bottle at yespr.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of citrus peel and hops with notes of rubber.
Fruity flavour of hops, citrus peel and grapefruits.
Dry hoppy finish.

10/05/2012 Open Baladin Roma (tap). Dorata, torbida, non bellissima a vedersi, con abbondante schiuma bianca, molto persistente. Al naso spicca laroma intenso di luppolo (nelson sauvin e soprattutto citra), molto agrumato, e del lievito da saison. In bocca è caratterizzata da un discreto amaro, deciso, persistente, con finale secco. Corpo medio, carbonazione generosa. Non è il mio genere di birra.

Bottled. An unclear golden beer with a thin yellowish head. The aroma has notes of fruits, spices, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of astringent hops, malt, wheat, and spices, leading to a dry finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a lacing white head. Very fresh and citrusy hop aroma. Medium body, a dry fruitiness, a little yeasty and astringent with good citrusy accents. Very dry and bitter finish. 200612

33 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a huge white head. Aroma is fruity, yeasty and light grassy. Light spiced, zesty, fruity and grapefruity. Bitter, bone dry and light fruity. Smooth fruity, citric and dry grapefruity finish.

Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of american hops, citra, malts, orange blossom, quite floral and lots of citrus. Bitter flavour, hops, light sweetness, pronounced citrus peel. Quite thin mouthfeel, finish fruity, bitter hops.
Lovely, quite floral, the name Zest is well chosen.
(Draught @ Moeder Lambic, Italian Beer Festival. Thanks for sharing, 77ships!)

Bottle from Birratrovo, ComoCloudy blond color; small sized head. Wonderful aroma of pungent fruity hops; there is passion fruit and citrus fruits. The body is weak and the mouthfeel extremely dry; not much malt flavor, but a very powerful and zesty hopping, citrusy, with a long final, a bit aggressive.

Colore gialo opaco, bel cappello di schiuma cremoso e persistente. Al naso molto luppolata, fruttata e intensa. In bocca prevalgono ancora luppolo, aromi floreali e malto. Ottimo finale amaro non stucchevole.

25 cl. draft @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas // Italian Beer Festival // lightly hazy golden with a nicely lacing fluffy white head // aroma is floral but in a very nice way strong citrus, zest indeed, clean & sharp // taste is sharp, clean citrus zest, touch of yeast, quite harsh bitter spices, floral, hay, lemon peel & touch of grass in the end // quite dry // another well-made Belgian beer by Extraomnes, my favourite so far

Pours hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Nose is spruce sap, citrus fruit and biscuits. Taste is great balance bittersweet. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Long aftertaste and light body. Refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[bottle at EBBC12] Golden beer with a large white head. Huge lemon sherbet aroma, lime zest  basically all kinds of pithy sharp citrus. Theres a bit of spice on the flavour, but mostly its the same charge of the lemon over your palate. Nice dry finish, which is where the floral, slightly yeasty flavour comes out, as well. Great stuff [18052012]

Draught  Huge fine white head over clouded yellow beer; rings of lace. USA hops with an overdose of ureum, very catty hops. Some (well, quite some) fruitiness too. Less catty in the flavour, still some valerian, and a lot of citruspeel. Light bodied, bit slick, backthroat a little burning feel. Far from bad, has indeed a pinch like citruszeste will lend to drink or a platter.

Cask @ BQ (Naviglio Grande). Hazy dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, yeast, grapefruit and hops. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, hops, grapefruit, medium sweet. spices, little citrus, little dry and a little bitter.

Bottle from Domus Birrae. Lovely hop aroma, grapefruit, lemon zest, iron, grass, light malts. Brilliant gold color with a fluffy white head. Lovely. Lemomy hop flavor, biscuit and bready malts, light honey, pepper. Low sweetness, and high bitterness in the finish. Very well hopped, maybe too bitter! Clean and crisp. A serious Belgian Ale, this one. A bit of dry, un-ripe tropical fruit goes with the citrus zest. Like green papaya or something. Very nice, though a bit harshly hopped for me. I would like it just a bit better balanced. Otherwise, this is exceptional.

Courtesy of Slayer85, thanks Andrea! Nose quite hoppy, flowers and light citrus with some light sweet pale malts. Taste is dry and lightly bitter, flowers and lemons, light honey sweetness, a touch of pear and some dusty yeast. Slightly less impressive than the Blonde, but the hops seemed to be a bit muted and may have been a slightly older bottle. Hopefully Ill get to try this on tap at some point.

beh.. devo dire una bella birra.Piacevole allolfatto,floreale e erbacea.al gusto ha saputo unire i malti con i luppoli americani con buon equilibrio.
Agrumata,floreale,erbacea e amarognola.buona complimenti.

Bottle @ Bir&Fud bottega.  Orange color, white head. Very very intense citrus aroma. Especially lemon. I got the citra and its strength finally. some spices and yeast after notes; weaker than the regular version anyhow  Great and strong pink grapefruits, lime taste. Medium bitterness, pleasant dry finish. A simple beer for an amazing result. very smart use of the hops as usual @ extraomnes. If ratebeer had the "drinkability" parameter, this beer should deserve 6/5. liters over liters of it.

30/10/2011 on tap @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà , Rome (2011-603)
Note: was marked as "Dry Hopped", dont know it that means its a differend beer, or if Zest is always dry hopped. Waiting for a reply from the brewery.
Cloudy yellow to light beige beer, creamy and stable head, adhesive. Aroma: first marijuana, lots of citrus, lemon, spices, citra hops?, wild flowers. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit cheesy, bit of citrus, bitter hops, grapefruit. Aftertaste: citrus fruit, oranges, very dry bitter ending.

Tap at Moeder Lambic St-Gilles. Nice golden yellow body with big puffy head. Nose is hoppy with citrus. Taste quite nice, lots of citrus and hops in there. Nice spike to it. Italians always bringing an original twist to their beers. Very enjoyable.

Draft @ Moeder Lambic St-Gilles.
Couleur dorée paille brumeuse, col pétillant blanc disparaissant assez vite.
Arôme de houblon, fruits tropicaux, pin laissant un bouquet très frais.
En bouche, note de levure pour un palais sec et poudreux avec qcq grains, profile du houblon est frais et onctueux laissant une très fine amertume de citron ou citronnelle ainsi que autres agrumes le tout conservant une pointe de douceur. 
Note herbacée avec sur la fin une touche dépice. 
Une très belle bière qui pour moi est entre une saison et une apa, limite esb qui se boit facilement.

.33l bottle from Domus Birrae in Rome. Spritely golden-yellow, yeasty body with huge foamy white head. Aroma is well-hopped golden belgian yeast. Sharp, sweet and lovely. Sharp, acidic bitter hops and citrus, spicy carbonation and big bitter finish. Strong flavors, very nicely hopped. Dry, bracing ale with citrus. really tasty.

Questa birra sta facendo furore. La prima che assaggiai era fantastica, ed era alla spina. La seconda in bottiglia sembrava ancora più complessa. Belga con luppoli americani, lunico birrificio ad aver azzeccato il connnubio!

Ho trovato questa Zest, davvero un ottimo prodotto, aroma notevole, dove figurano bene i luppoli made in USA, e anche al palato soddisfa lasciandolo secco e voglioso di un altro sorso. Anche molto beverina.

Bottle from GBBF. Bright yellow beer, with a bit of head. Aroma is slightly sour Belgian Ale. First thing to note in taste is a big whack of NZ hops - fresh and sunshiney, with some mango. Then things dry out dramatically, with a pithy, citrus peel spritz. The name of the beer says it all. A most pleasant drinkable beer.

2nd August 2011GBBF, Bottle split with Scopey and Leighton. Clear pale gold beer, medium off white head. Light semi dry palate. Crisp. Bitterish peel and living up to the name of the beer we get zesty orange and grapefruit. Some minerals. Nice fresh zesty beer - does what it says on the tin!

Bottle at GBBF 2011, Day 1, shared with Ken and Paul. Pours hazy yellow with a ghostly, white head. Big spice nose, some light doughy malts. Sweet flavor, light pepper, some grass, mild lemon. Light to medium in body with average carbonation. Major grassy finish, mild earth, rindy citrus. Very fucking good. I liked it a lot. Way to go, Extraomnes.

Color oro, torbida, schiuma abbondante e persistente, aroma subito citrico, fieno, lievito, fiori di campo (?), al palato è fresca, perfettamente estiva, secca. un grado in più è diventava la mia birra dellanno.

Bottle at GBBF 2011. It pours hazy straw yellow, with a thick, foamy white head. The nose is pear, melon, lemon, yeast, hay and grass. The taste is tangerine, orange, apricot, mango, sweet malt, grass, hay, yeast and cereal, with a dry finish. Medium body and average carbonation. A decent, fruity Belgian-style ale.
Draft at Bir&Fud courtesy of Manuele - thanks!  Cloudy yellow color, massive white head.  Aroma of bakers yeast and limoncello.  Taste has tons of malt, but good balance.  Amazing for a 5% beer.
UPDATED: FEB 3, 2012 Incredibile come lavori bene questo birrificio. Perfetta per lesatate, beverina e bevibile, e al naso è un esplosione di profumi.

Draught @ Cruise Roma - Barcelona, Un Mare di Birra, Grimaldi Lines.Light unclear medium yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, toasted, sweet malt, wet hay, fruity, moderate yeasty. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, spicy yeast, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110611]

Transparent gold with heavy lacing, creamy white head. Nose is peppery hop, bubblegum, quite green and minty. Flavor is leafy hop, bit doughy across mid, back is harshly bitter, stinging dryness, lightly oily and harsh. Prefer fresher, more integrated hop profile.

Appearance: yellow, like a whit
Aroma: Citrus hops, bread and grass
Tastee: well hopped!
Palate: thinbody
Overall: 17/20
Refeshing!

Un zeste de citron..lemon incest! Finalmente bevo una birra di Schigi e non è improbabile che mi stia leggendo che emozion. Comunque un vero gioiello, strepitosamente profumata e beverina, un luppolo bagascio usato con una certa sapienza; lieto di scoprire (non lo ricordavo) che sarà anche a Pasturana.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2011 Alla spina al BQ di Via Losanna, Milano; bel taglio amaro e un aroma fantastico, sembra di avere una pesca nel bicchiere.  Aumento il voto perchè la versione in dry hop è ancora meglio, e NON E un alias.
